data.title: FAA Statements on Aviation Accidents and Incidents
data.meta_description: The information below is preliminary and subject to change. News media with questions on other topics may contact us at pressoffice@faa.gov.      For General Aviation:
data.text:
The information below is preliminary and subject to change. News media with questions on other topics may contact us at pressoffice@faa.gov.

For General Aviation:

• Contact local authorities for the names and medical conditions of anyone on board.

• A preliminary FAA report will be posted, usually on the next business day.

• If known, the aircraft registration number (N-number) can be searched at the Aircraft Registry.

• If the National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) is also investigating, it will provide all updates.

For Commercial Aviation:

• Contact the airline for information about passengers and crew, flights and schedules.

• If the National Transportation Safety Board is also investigating, it will provide all updates.

July 20, 2024

Commercial Aviation / Raleigh-Durham, NC

American Airlines Flight 2131 landed safely at Raleigh-Durham International Airport around 8:50 a.m. local time on Saturday, July 20, after the crew reported an engine oil leak. The Boeing 737 Max 8 departed from John F. Kennedy International Airport in New York en route to Miami International Airport. The FAA will investigate. Contact the airline for passenger information.

General Aviation / Youngstown, NY

A single-engine Cessna 208B crashed near Lake Road in Youngstown, New York, around 12:50 p.m. local time on Saturday, July 20. The pilot, and only person on board, was conducting parachute operations. The FAA and National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide any updates.

General Aviation / Englewood, CO

A twin-engine Rockwell Aero Commander 500S veered off the runway and into the grass while landing at Centennial Airport in Englewood, Colorado, around 11 a.m. local time on Saturday, July 20. The pilot returned to the airport after reporting engine issues. Two people were on board. The FAA and National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

July 19, 2024

Commercial Aviation / Boston, MA

JetBlue Flight 772 landed safely at General Edward Lawrence Logan International Airport in Boston around 5:10 p.m. local time on Friday, July 19, after the crew reported smoke in the cockpit. The Airbus 321 arrived from Cancun International Airport in Mexico. Contact the airport and airline for more information. The FAA will investigate.

General Aviation / Youngstown, OH

A twin-engine Beechcraft 60 crashed near Youngstown-Warren Regional Airport in Ohio around 6:45 p.m. local time on Friday, July 19. Three people were on board. The FAA and National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

General Aviation / Hegins Township, PA

A helicopter struck a power line and crashed in a corn field in Hegins Township, PA around 1:08 p.m. local time on Friday, July 19. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA will investigate.

General Aviation / Palmyra, PA

A single-engine Kitfox Model IV crashed in a corn field in Palmyra, PA around 2:40 p.m. local time on Friday, July 19. Two people were on board. The FAA will investigate.

Commercial Aviation / U.S. Airlines Service Impacts

The FAA is closely monitoring a technical issue impacting IT systems at U.S. airlines. Several airlines have requested FAA assistance with ground stops for their fleets until the issue is resolved. For more information, monitor fly.faa.gov for updates.

July 16, 2024

General Aviation / Easton, MD

A twin-engine Cessna 402 crashed into the water near Easton, Maryland around 9:30 a.m. local time on Tuesday, July 16, after the pilot reported engine failure. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

General Aviation / Eagle Lake, TX

A McDonnell Douglas MD600 helicopter crashed in Eagle Lake, Texas, around 1 a.m. local time on Tuesday, July 16. Six people were on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide any updates.

July 15, 2024

General Aviation / San Diego, CA

The landing gear of a twin-engine Beechcraft 55 Baron collapsed when the plane landed at Montgomery-Gibbs Executive Airport in San Diego around 1:05 p.m. local time on Monday, July 15. The two people on board were not injured. The FAA will investigate.

July 13, 2024

Commercial Aviation / St. Louis, Missouri

Delta Air Lines Flight 927 landed safely at St. Louis Lambert International Airport around 11:35 a.m. local time on Saturday, July 13, after the crew reported a possible pressurization issue. The Boeing 757-200 departed from Jackson Hole Airport in Wyoming and was originally heading to Hartsfield – Jackson Atlanta International Airport. Contact the airline for more information. The FAA will investigate.

Commercial Aviation / Atlanta, Georgia

Delta Air Lines Flight 1950 returned to and landed safely at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport around 12:30 p.m. local time on Saturday, July 13, after the crew reported a mechanical issue. The Boeing 757-200 was scheduled to fly to St. Thomas in the United States Virgin Islands. The FAA is investigating. Please contact the airline for additional information.

July 12, 2024

Commercial Aviation / San Francisco, California

The crew of American Airlines Flight 2045 reported smoke on board while at the gate at San Francisco International Airport. Passengers exited the Airbus A321 using emergency slides. The incident occurred around 12:15 p.m. local time on Friday, July 12. Contact the airport and the airline for more information. The FAA will investigate.

General Aviation / Roxborough Park, Colorado

A single-engine Van’s RV-4 landed in Roxborough State Park in Colorado around 12:15 p.m. local time on Friday, July 12. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

July 11, 2024

Commercial Space / Vandenberg Space Force Base, California - UPDATED

The FAA is aware an anomaly occurred during the SpaceX Starlink Group 9-3 mission that launched from Vandenberg Space Force Base in California on July 11. The incident involved the failure of the upper stage rocket while it was in space. No public injuries or public property damage have been reported. The FAA is requiring an investigation.

Background

An investigation is designed to further enhance public safety, determine the root cause of the event, and identify corrective actions to avoid it from happening again.

The FAA will be involved in every step of the investigation process and must approve SpaceX’s final report, including any corrective actions.

A return to flight is based on the FAA determining that any system, process, or procedure related to the mishap does not affect public safety. In addition, SpaceX may need to request and receive approval from the FAA to modify its license that incorporates any corrective actions and meet all other licensing requirements.

General Aviation / Kauai, Hawaii

A Robinson R44 helicopter crashed off Kauai’s Nepali Coast around 2 p.m. local time on Thursday, July 11. Three people were on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

July 10, 2024

General Aviation / West Palm Beach, Florida

A single-engine Piper P28A crashed into a pond after taking off from North Palm Beach County General Aviation Airport in Florida around 2:50 p.m. local time on Wednesday, July 10. The number of persons on board is unknown at this time. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will lead the investigation and will provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Helena, Montana

A single-engine Air Tractor 802A crashed into Hauser Lake in Helena, Montana at 12:10 p.m. local time on Wednesday, July 10. Only one person was on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will lead the investigation and will provide any updates.

Commercial Aviation / Tampa, Florida

American Airlines Flight 590 aborted its takeoff from Tampa International Airport around 7:50 a.m. local time on Wednesday, July 10, after the crew reported multiple blown tires. Passenger deplaned on the taxiway and were bused to the terminal. The flight was headed to Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport. The FAA will investigate. Please contact the airline for additional information.

Investigation and Other Information

July 8, 2024

Commercial Aviation / Las Vegas, Nevada

WestJet Flight 1449 returned to and landed safely at Harry Reid International Airport in Las Vegas around 9:45 p.m. local time on Monday, July 8, after the crew reported a possible engine issue. The Boeing 737-700 was headed to Edmonton International Airport in Canada. The FAA will investigate. Please contact the airline for more information.

Investigation and Other Information

Commercial Aviation / Los Angeles, California

The crew of United Airlines Flight 1001 reported the plane lost a tire during takeoff from Los Angeles International Airport on Monday, July 8. The Boeing 757-200 continued to Denver International Airport where it landed safely around 10:10 a.m. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Titusville, Florida

The landing gear of a twin-engine Cessna T337E collapsed when the plane landed at Space Coast Regional Airport in Titusville, Florida, around 12:40 p.m. local time on Monday, July 8. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

Commercial Aviation / Boston, Massachusetts

British Airways Flight 29C landed safely at Boston Logan International Airport around 5:10 a.m. local time on Monday, July 8, after the crew reported smoke in the cabin. The Airbus A380 departed from Washington Dulles International Airport and was headed to London Heathrow International Airport. The FAA will investigate. Please contact the airline for additional information

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Rutherfordton, North Carolina

A single-engine Cessna 182 crashed in the mountains near Rutherfordton, North Carolina, around 6:45 a.m. local time on Monday, July 8. Three people were on board. The FAA and National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

Investigation and Other Information

July 7, 2024

General Aviation / Macon County, Tennessee

A single-engine Super Drifter crashed at Lafayette Municipal Airport in Macon County, Tennessee, around 4:30 p.m. local time on Sunday, July 7. Two people were on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

Investigation and Other Information

July 6, 2024

General Aviation / Williams, Arizona

A Cameron C-100 hot air balloon crashed into multiple light poles and a parked car near Williams, Arizona, after a wind gust picked up and drug the balloon while it was being inflated around 12:20 local time on Saturday. No one was on board. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Eatonville, Washington

A single-engine Champion 7GCB Challenger crashed shortly after takeoff near Eatonville, Washington, around 10:20 p.m. local time on Saturday July 6. Two people were on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Fort Morgan, Colorado

The pilot of a single-engine Cessna 172 made an emergency landing on Interstate 76 near Fort Morgan, Colorado, around 2:30 p.m. local time on Saturday July 6. Two people were on board. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

July 5, 2024

General Aviation / Dayton, Nevada

The pilot of a twin-engine Aero Commander 500 made an emergency landing on Highway 50 near Dayton, Nevada, around 12:10 p.m. local time on Friday, July 5. Three people were on board. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

July 4, 2024

General Aviation / Devils Thumb, Colorado

A single-engine Cessna 152 landed safely at its destination after it stalled and descended near Devils Thumb, Colorado, around 12:30 p.m. local time on Thursday, July 4. The number of people on board is unknown at this time. The FAA is investigating.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Sherman, Texas

A single-engine Globe GC-1B clipped a fence during takeoff from a private grass strip and crashed into a ditch near Sherman, Texas, around 8:15 p.m. local time on Thursday, July 4. Two people were on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Frankford, Delaware

A single-engine Bellanca 8G-CBC banner-tow plane crashed near Frankford, Delaware, around 4 p.m. local time on Thursday, July 4. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Lock Haven, Pennsylvania

A single-engine Cessna 172 crashed in a wooded area near Lock Haven, Pennsylvania, around 10:30 a.m. local time on Thursday, July 4. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

Investigation and Other Information

July 3, 2024

Commercial Aviation / Chicago, Illinois

United Airlines Flight 343 returned to and landed safely at Chicago O'Hare International Airport around noon local time on Wednesday, July 3, after the crew reported a pressurization issue. The Boeing 737-900 was en route to San Francisco International Airport. The FAA will investigate. Please contact the airline for additional information.

Investigation and Other Information

Commercial Aviation / New York, New York

Delta Air Lines Flight 136 landed safely at John F. Kennedy International Airport in New York around 4 a.m. local time on Wednesday July 3, after the crew reported several sick passengers on board. The Airbus A330 departed Detroit Metropolitan Airport and was headed to Amsterdam, Netherlands. Please contact the airline for additional information.

Investigation and Other Information

July 2, 2024

Commercial Aviation / Eugene, Oregon

SkyWest Airlines Flight 3352 landed safely at Mahlon Sweet Field Airport in Eugene, Oregon, around 11 a.m. local time on Tuesday, July 2, after the crew reported a possible landing gear issue. The Embraer E75L departed from Los Angeles International Airport. The FAA will investigate. Please contact the airline for more information.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Lexington, North Carolina

A single-engine Glasair III ran through a grassy area while taxiing and flipped over at Davidson County Executive Airport in Lexington, North Carolina, around 8:30 p.m. local time on Tuesday, July 2. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / San Diego, California

A single-engine Cessna 172 crashed and flipped over at Montgomery-Gibbs Executive Airport in San Diego around noon local time on Tuesday, July 2. Two people were on board .The FAA and the NTSB will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

June 30, 2024

Commercial Aviation / Phoenix

Spirit Airlines Flight 816 landed safely at Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport around 4 p.m. local time on Sunday, June 30, after the crew reported a burning smell in the flight deck. The Airbus A320 was flying from Los Angeles International Airport to Kansas City International Airport. The FAA will investigate. Please contact the airline for additional information.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Sidney, New York

A single-engine Piper PA-46 crashed near Sidney, New York, around 2 p.m. local time on Sunday, June 30. The plane departed from Albert S. Nader Regional Airport in Oneonta, New York, with five people on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Saluda, South Carolina

A single-engine Van’s RV-9 crashed on the Persimmon Hill golf course in Saluda, South Carolina, around 10:30 a.m. local time on Sunday, June 30. Two people were on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

Investigation and Other Information

June 27, 2024

Commercial Aviation / Newark, New Jersey

The FAA is slowing the flow of aircraft into Newark Liberty International Airport because an Embraer business jet went off the runway after landing. This resulted in a temporary runway closure which reduced the airport's arrival capacity.

Please contact the airport for additional information. You can get real-time updates at www.fly.faa.gov.

General Aviation / McKinney, Texas

A twin-engine Cessna 414 crashed into a construction site after departing McKinney National Airport in Texas around 10:25 a.m. local time on Thursday, June 27. Three people were on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will lead the investigation and provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

June 26, 2024

General Aviation / DeLand, Florida

An unidentified small aircraft crashed into a yard in DeLand, Florida, around 3:10 p.m. local time on Wednesday, June 26. Two people were on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will lead the investigation and provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

June 25, 2024

Commercial Aviation / Portland, Maine

Southwest Airlines Flight 4805 departed from a temporarily closed runway at the Portland International Jetport on Tuesday, June 25. An airport vehicle exited the runway before the plane began its takeoff roll. The FAA and NTSB are investigating the event, which occurred around 5:45 a.m. local time.

General Aviation / Swans Island, Maine

A single-engine Cessna 150 crashed into trees at Banks Airport on Swans Island, Maine, around 5:50 p.m. on Tuesday, June 25. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will lead the investigation and provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Jacksboro, Texas

A single-engine Cessna 152 landed in a field south of Jacksboro Municipal Airport in Jacksboro, Texas, around 4:20 p.m. local time on Tuesday, June 25. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / New Ipswich, New Hampshire

A single-engine SeaRey crashed near Turnpike Road in New Ipswich, New Hampshire, around 12:50 p.m. local time on Tuesday, June 25. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA and National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Pleasant Grove, California

A single-engine Republic RC-3 clipped a fence and struck a car while departing from a private airport in Pleasant Grove, California, around 6 a.m. local time on Tuesday, June 25. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA and National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

Investigation and Other Information

June 24, 2024

General Aviation / Fire Island, New York

A single-engine Piper PA-28 landed on Atlantique Beach, in Fire Island, New York, around 12:15 p.m. local time on Monday, June 24. Two people were on board. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

Commercial Aviation / Newark, New Jersey

Republic Airways Flight 3702 returned to and landed safely at Newark Liberty International Airport around 4:45 p.m. local time on Monday, June 24, after the crew reported a cracked windshield. The Embraer 175 was headed to Greenville-Spartanburg International Airport in South Carolina. The FAA will investigate. Please contact the airline for additional information.

Investigation and Other Information

June 23, 2024

General Aviation / Atlanta, Georgia

A single-engine Cirrus SR20 veered off the runway during departure at DeKalb-Peachtree Airport in Georgia around 1 p.m. local time on Sunday, June 23. Three people were on board. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

June 21, 2024

General Aviation / Morrisville, North Carolina

A single-engine Piper PA-28 veered off the end of the runway after landing at Raleigh-Durham International Airport around 7:30 p.m. local time on Friday, June 21. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

Commercial Aviation / Greensboro, North Carolina

A garbage truck struck the winglet of American Airlines Flight 1716 during boarding at Piedmont Triad International Airport in Greensboro, North Carolina, around 6:45 a.m. local time on Friday, June 21. The Boeing 737-800 was scheduled to fly from Greensboro to Dallas-Fort Worth. The FAA is investigating. Please contact the airline for additional information.

General Aviation / Brooksville, Florida

A single-engine Cessna 172N crashed on a street in Brooksville, Florida, around 1:20 p.m. local time Friday, June 21. The aircraft was en route to Brooksville-Tampa Bay Regional Airport. Two people were on board. The FAA and National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

June 20, 2024

Commercial Aviation / Windsor Locks, Connecticut

United Airlines Flight 325 returned safely to Bradley International Airport in Connecticut around 8:45 a.m. local time on Thursday, June 20, after the crew reported an abnormal noise. The Airbus A320 was headed to Denver International Airport. The FAA will investigate. Please contact the airline for additional information.

Investigation and Other Information

Commercial Aviation / Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Piedmont Airlines and Frontier Airlines jets were cleared to land on intersecting runways at Philadelphia International Airport. An air traffic controller instructed the Piedmont crew to go around, and the Frontier crew performed a pilot-initiated go-around. The FAA is investigating the event, which occurred around 4:55 p.m. local time on Thursday, June 20.

June 19, 2024

General Aviation / Davenport, Washington

A Robinson R-44 helicopter crashed near Davenport, Washington, around 4:30 p.m. local time on Wednesday, June 19. Two people were on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

Commercial Aviation / Oklahoma City, Oklahoma

After an automated warning sounded, an air traffic controller alerted the crew of Southwest Airlines Flight 4069 that the aircraft had descended to a low altitude nine miles away from Will Rogers World Airport in Oklahoma City.

The FAA is investigating the incident that occurred around 12:05 a.m. local time on Wednesday, June 19. Please contact the airline for additional information.

June 18, 2024

General Aviation / Lawing, Alaska

A single-engine Piper PA-18 float plane crashed at Crescent Lake in Lawing, Alaska, around 2 p.m. local time on Tuesday, June 18. Two people were on board. The FAA and National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

Investigation and Other Information

June 17, 2024

General Aviation / Jackson, Georgia

A twin-engine Lockheed 12A crashed while the pilot was trying to land at Seven Lakes Airport in Jackson, Georgia, around 8 p.m. local time on Monday, June 17. Three people were on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Steamboat Springs, Colorado

A twin-engine Cessna 421 crashed in a residential area while approaching Steamboat Springs Airport/Bob Adams Field in Colorado around 4:30 p.m. local time on Monday, June 17. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Lawrence, Massachusetts

A single-engine Van’s RV-6A crashed into the Merrimack River in Lawrence, Massachusetts, around 2:15 p.m. local time on Monday, June 17. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will lead the investigation and provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Albany, New York

A twin-engine Piper PA-31 crashed near the end of the runway at Albany International Airport in New York around 8:15 a.m. local time on Monday, June 17. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates..

Investigation and Other Information

Commercial Aviation / Hebron, Kentucky

Cargojet Airways Flight 1926 returned safely to Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport around 1:30 p.m. local time on Monday, June 17, after the crew reported a panel fell from the aircraft. The Boeing 767 was scheduled to fly to Vancouver International Airport in Richmond, British Columbia. The FAA is investigating. Please contact the airline for more information.

Investigation and Other Information

June 16, 2024

General Aviation / Androscoggin River, Maine

A single-engine Aeronca 7AC crashed into the Androscoggin River in Maine around 10:45 a.m. local time on Sunday, June 16. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Chatham, Massachusetts

The pilot of a single-engine Cessna 172 reported an engine issue and landed on Coast Guard Beach in Chatham, Massachusetts, around 3:45 p.m. local time on Sunday, June 16. Three people were on board. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Larkspur, Colorado

A twin-engine Tecnam P2006T crashed on Interstate 25 in Larkspur, Colorado, around 7:50 a.m. local time on Sunday, June 16. Two people were on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

June 15, 2024

General Aviation / Chino, California

A twin-engine Lockheed 12A crashed shortly after departing Chino Airport in California around 12:35 p.m. local time on Saturday, June 15. Two people were on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

June 14, 2024

General Aviation / Siler City, North Carolina

A single-engine Piper PA-28 crashed near Siler City Municipal Airport in North Carolina around 12:50 p.m. local time on Friday, June 14. Two people were on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

Commercial Aviation / Spokane, Washington

Sun Country Flight 286 landed safely at Spokane International Airport in Washington around 8:05 p.m. local time on Friday, June 14, after the pilot reported possible engine issues. The Boeing 737-800 was flying from Seattle-Tacoma International Airport to Minneapolis-Saint Paul International Airport. The FAA is investigating. Please contact the airline for additional information.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Morton, Texas

Two Air Tractor AT-502s collided in midair while crop-dusting near Morton, Texas, around 8:40 a.m. local time on Friday, June 14. Only the pilots were on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Broseley, Missouri

An Air Tractor AT-602 crashed near Broseley, Missouri, around 8:30 a.m. local time on Friday, June 14. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA and NTSB will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

June 13, 2024

General Aviation / South Lake Tahoe, California

Search crews found the wreckage of a single-engine Luscombe 8A near South Lake Tahoe, California, around 5:30 a.m. local time Thursday, June 13. Two people were on board. The plane departed Wednesday afternoon from Lodi Airport. The FAA and National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

June 12, 2024

General Aviation / Woodland, California

A single-engine Cessna A185 landed in a cornfield near Watts - Woodland Airport in California around 11:15 a.m. local time on Wednesday, June 12, after the pilot reported engine failure. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA and National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide further updates.

Investigation and Other Information

June 11, 2024

General Aviation / Gainesville, Texas

A single-engine Cessna 172 crashed near Gainesville Municipal Airport in Texas, around 8:50 p.m. local time Tuesday, June 11. Two people were on board. The aircraft departed from Denton Enterprise Airport, also in Texas.

The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

June 10, 2024

Commercial Aviation / Oakland, California

The crew of Executive Jet Airways Flight 686 reported a bird strike and returned safely to Metro Oakland International Airport around 12:30 p.m. local time on Monday, June 10. The twin-jet Cessna Citation Latitude aircraft was traveling to Minneapolis-St. Paul International Airport. The FAA will investigate. Contact the airline for additional information.

June 9, 2024

General Aviation / Ann Arbor, Michigan

A single-engine Piper PA-28 crashed near Ann Arbor Municipal Airport in Michigan around 1:10 p.m. local time on Monday, June 10, 2024. Two people were on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

June 8, 2024

General Aviation / Marana, Arizona

A single-engine Rans S-12XL Airaile crashed near Marana, Arizona, around 7:30 a.m. local time on Saturday, June 8, 2024. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Jonesborough, Tennessee

A single-engine Cessna 182 crashed in the woods near Jonesborough, Tennessee, around 11 a.m. local time on Saturday, June 8, 2024. Two people were on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Tennille, Georgia

A single-engine JA30 Superstol crashed in a backyard near Tennille, Georgia, around 7:40 p.m. local time on Saturday, June 8, 2024. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will be in charge of the investigation and will provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

June 7, 2024

General Aviation / Arvada, Colorado

A single-engine Beechcraft 35 crashed in a residential area in Arvada, Colorado, around 9:30 a.m. on Friday, June 7. Four people were on board. The aircraft departed from Centennial Airport in Colorado. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate. The NTSB will lead the investigation and provide any updates.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Roche Harbor, Washington

A Beechcraft T-34 Mentor crashed into the water near Roche Harbor, Washington, around 11:40 a.m. local time Friday, June 7. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

June 6, 2024

General Aviation / Fort Worth, Texas

A twin-engine Beechcraft Model 18 veered off the runway and into the grass after landing at Fort Worth Meacham International Airport around 5:30 p.m. local time Thursday, June 6. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

June 5, 2024

Commercial Aviation / Newark, New Jersey

United Airlines Flight 30 returned safely to Newark Liberty International Airport around 6:45 p.m. local time on Wednesday, June 5, after the crew reported an alarm. The Boeing 767-400 was en route to Munich, Germany. The FAA will investigate. Please contact the airline for more information.

Investigation and Other Information

Commercial Aviation / Boston, Massachusetts

Qatar Airways Flight 98Y landed safely at Boston Logan International Airport around 7:45 a.m. on Wednesday, June 5, after the crew reported possible hydraulic issues. The Airbus A350 took off from Doha in Qatar. The FAA will investigate. Please contact the airline for additional information.

Investigation and Other Information

June 4, 2024

General Aviation / Loxahatchee, Florida

The pilot of a single-engine Rans S-19 Venterra reported engine issues and made an emergency landing on a road in Loxahatchee, Florida, around 11:30 p.m. local time on Tuesday, June 4. Only the pilot was on board. The FAA will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

June 3, 2024

General Aviation / Hebron, Indiana

A Lindstrom hot air balloon crashed after striking power lines in Hebron, Indiana, around 6:50 p.m. local time on Sunday, June 2. Three people were on board. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board will investigate.

Investigation and Other Information

General Aviation / Litchfield County, Connecticut
